Class Assignment2

  • java.lang.Object
    • Assignment2

  • public class Assignment2
extends java.lang.Object
    This program provides a GUI to take a binary string from the user and converts the input from binary to decimal and displays the result in a text field in the interface.
    Since:
    2017-07-05
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dave Arnold

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Assignment2.Handler
      This class monitors and handles user input.

      Assignment2() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method that uses Java Swing to create a GUI.
      static void parseBinary(java.lang.String s)
      This method validates user input is a binary string and throws NumberFormatException if it is not.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Assignment2

        public Assignment2()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method that uses Java Swing to create a GUI. It uses the Handler class to monitor button clicks, and to capture input in the binaryTextField.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused

      • parseBinary

        public static void parseBinary(java.lang.String s)
                        throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        This method validates user input is a binary string and throws NumberFormatException if it is not. If the user enters a valid binary string, this method will parse the string as a long with base 2, and display the result to the user in the decimalTextField of the GUI.
        Parameters:
        s - String of elements entered by user
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - when user enters an invalid binary character
